text.0: thou first inventor of this prayer o agni worker of marvels hast become our herald.
text.1: thou bull hast made us strength which none may conquer strength that shall overcome all other prowess.
text.2: as priest thou sattest at the seat of worship furthering us best offerer meet for honour.
text.3: so first to thee have pious men resorted turning thy mind to thoughts of ample riches.
text.4: in thee still watching they have followed riches who goest with much wealth as with an army.
text.5: the radiant agni lofty fair to look on worshipped with marrow evermore resplendent.
text.6: they who approached the gods abode with homage eager for glory won them perfect glory.
text.7: yea they gained even sacrificial titles and found delight in thine auspicious aspect.
text.8: on earth the people magnify thee greatly thee their celestial and terrestrial riches.
text.9: thou helper must be known as our preserver father and mother of mankind for ever.
text.10: dear priest among mankind adorable agni hath seated him joygiver skilled in worship.
text.11: let us approach thee shining in thy dwelling kneeling upon our knees with adoration.
text.12: longing for bliss pureminded goddevoted agni we seek thee such meet to be lauded.
text.13: thou agni leddest forth our men to battle refulgent with the heavens exalted splendour.
text.14: sage of mankind all peoples lord and master the bull of men the sender down of blessings.
text.15: still pressing on promoting purifying agni the holy one the lord of riches.
text.16: agni the mortal who hath toiled and worshipped brought thee oblations with his kindled fuel.
text.17: and well knows sacrifice with adoration gains every joy with thee to guard and help him.
text.18: mightily let us worship thee the mighty with reverence agni fuel and oblations.
text.19: with songs o son of strength with hymns with altar so may we strive for thine auspicious favour.
text.20: thou who hast covered heaven and earth with splendour and with thy glories glorious and triumphant.
text.21: continue thou to shine on us o agni with strength abundant rich and long enduring.
text.22: vouchsafe us ever as man needs o vasu abundant wealth of kine for son and offspring.
text.23: food noble plenteous far from sin and evil he with us and fair fame to make us happy.
text.24: may i obtain much wealth in many places by love of thee and through thy grace king agni.
text.25: for in thee bounteous one in thee the sovran agni are many boons for him who serves thee.
